entry.et: Middle English chep, from Old English cēap trade; akin to Old High German kouf trade; both ultimately from Latin caupo tradesman

def.dt: :at minimum expense :cheaply did the job on the cheap
:purchasable below the going price or the real value
:charging or obtainable at a low price a good cheap hotel cheap tickets
:depreciated in value (as by currency inflation) cheap dollars
:gained or done with little effort a cheap victory talk is cheap
:of inferior quality or worth :tawdry sleazy cheap workmanship
:contemptible because of lack of any fine, lofty, or redeeming qualities feeling cheap
:obtainable at a low rate of interest
:an act of deliberate roughness against a defenseless opponent especially in a contact sport taking cheap shots at the quarterback
:a critical statement that takes unfair advantage of a known weakness of the target
